meanings.definition: A member of a group of early 20th-century British artists who sought to capture the dynamism of the modern world through abstract forms and bold colors.
meanings.sent1: The vorticists gathered to discuss their latest abstract artworks.
meanings.sent2: Many vorticists exhibited their vibrant paintings at the art gallery.
meanings.sent3: The vorticists decided to paint a giant abstract mural on the city wall.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity spun like a vorticist's brush on the canvas of life.
meanings.sent5: The vorticists' art was like a whirlwind of colors and shapes, mesmerizing all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A style of art characterized by abstract geometric shapes and vibrant colors, influenced by the vorticists movement.
meanings.sent1: The museum displayed a collection of vorticists' artworks.
meanings.sent2: She admired the vorticists' use of bold colors in their paintings.
meanings.sent3: The room was decorated in a vorticists-inspired theme, with geometric patterns everywhere.
meanings.sent4: His mind was a vorticists' canvas, swirling with ideas and colors.
meanings.sent5: The vorticists' style brought a burst of energy to the art world, like a colorful tornado.
